body: Hi David, I wasn't able to recreate the error that you got on my system as the file worked fine. See the screenshots below: [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/p9ey71ICjWdzJDQE7Lgw35zVhANPS1wLqbxDxoM6t0SkqwdAz0uTFsvIxO7NF5bnehgijWv5XHt-lZAzSrURl79X*3dWlhXA/rhino.PNG)[](http://api.ning.com:80/files/p9ey71ICjWeoHTFkfW4iAu7Ya7VotyF3F61VnAYG1JXM9vgMzxUwByiqOcxrBXH3JVV3GmYuqNOYlVfkdV9qZid-UTS2Hsra/luminaire.PNG)[](http://api.ning.com:80/files/p9ey71ICjWforOwR37VNWjZo5nqee5cMzdQoTTjReUvzTh5nGF3xHNwyXG-kmDyeAV1KI03Uxm9ZMah2cYl1-z62iKvwkjn3/render.PNG)I have attached my gh file. Can you get this one to work ? The input from the electric lighting component will add to whatever daylighting you have in your scene. So, it should work the way you want. When you talk of lighting control and watts, are you using Daysim to run the annual calculations ?
